skill.name: building-plugins
skill.description: Expert at creating and managing Claude Code plugins that bundle agents, skills, commands, and hooks into cohesive packages. Auto-invokes when the user wants to create, structure, validate, or publish a complete plugin, or needs help with plugin architecture and best practices. Also auto-invokes proactively when Claude is about to create plugin directory structures, write plugin.json manifests, or implement tasks that involve bundling components into a plugin package.

security_audit.summary: This is a meta-skill for plugin creation. It contains validation scripts and template files for scaffolding Claude Code plugins. All scripts perform defensive validation and include security checks. No credential theft, network calls, or persistence mechanisms found.

low_findings.title: Bash scripts execute shell commands
low_findings.description:
Shell scripts in templates execute commands using find and grep utilities. These are standard development tools for file operations and pattern matching. Scripts include defensive checks and do not execute arbitrary user input.

Example from helper.sh line 24: `find . -name "$pattern" -type f`

low_findings.title: Python script validates plugin directories
low_findings.description:
The validation script accesses filesystem to validate plugin structure. This is necessary for its purpose of checking plugin directories and components.

Lines 29-30: Directory existence check with `plugin_path.is_dir()`
Lines 33-36: plugin.json file existence check

content.value_statement: Building complete plugins from scattered components is time-consuming and error-prone. This skill provides templates, validation scripts, and best practices for creating professional Claude Code plugins that bundle agents, skills, commands, and hooks into distributable packages.
actual_capabilities: Create plugin directory structures from templates
Write valid plugin.json manifests with schema validation
Validate plugins against Claude Code requirements
limitations: Does not execute user code or modify external files without explicit request
Does not connect to external APIs or services
Does not require network access for core functionality
Templates are for scaffolding only and require customization

use_cases.title: Create new plugins
use_cases.description: Scaffold complete plugin structures with minimal, standard, or full templates including all components

use_cases.title: Standardize team plugins
use_cases.description: Enforce consistent plugin architecture across team with validation and best practice guidelines

use_cases.title: Submit to marketplace
use_cases.description: Prepare plugins for marketplace submission with proper versioning, documentation, and registration

output_examples.input: Create a plugin for code review with security scanning
output: Generated plugin.json with all required fields
Created agents/security-auditor.md for deep security analysis
Created skills/reviewing-code/ for auto-invoked review expertise

best_practices: Start with minimal functionality and iterate based on feedback
Validate plugins with the validation script before publishing
Keep plugin components cohesive around a single purpose
anti_patterns: Creating monolithic plugins that do too many unrelated things
Skipping validation checks before publishing plugins
Not updating marketplace.json when adding new plugins

faq.question: What is the minimum required structure for a plugin?
faq.answer: A plugin requires only a .claude-plugin/plugin.json and README.md file to be valid

faq.question: How many components can a plugin have?
faq.answer: Plugins can have unlimited components but should maintain cohesion around a single purpose

faq.question: Can plugins depend on other plugins?
faq.answer: No, plugins cannot directly depend on other plugins. Document requirements in README.md instead

faq.question: Is my data safe when using this skill?
faq.answer: Yes. This skill only creates and validates files in locations you specify. It does not access external systems or transmit data

faq.question: Why does validation fail on my plugin.json?
faq.answer: Common issues include: invalid JSON syntax, missing required fields, non-lowercase plugin name, or non-semantic version numbers

faq.question: How does this compare to building individual components?
faq.answer: Plugins bundle multiple components for easy distribution. Individual components work better for one-off customizations in specific projects
